text:
My kwentong jeepney:
I was in Diliman and sumakay ako ng jeep na pa-Quezon Av. Umupo ako sa tabi ni Manong Driver and nagkwentuhan pa kame. Sobrang bangag ko from work, bumaba ako ng jeep without giving my bayad. Wondering why may barya sa pocket ko which is intended for the fare
translated:
My Story Jeepney:
I was in Diliman and I rode a jeep in Quezon av.I sat down next to the driver and we talked.I was so tired from work, I got off a jeep without giving my fee.Wondering why there is a coin in my pocket which is intended for the fare

text:
She said, "God bless you."

A kind woman just paid my transportation fee (jeepney) today. She was really kind to do that. I'm grateful. 

I got a hundred but it's useless since kuya had no change for it. However, she insisted on paying my fare. May God bless her too.
translated:
She said, "God bless you."

A kind woman just paid my transportation fee (jeepney) today.She was really kind to do that.I'm grateful.

I got a hundred but it's useless since Kuya had no change for it.However, she insisted on paying my fare.May God bless her too.

text:
üö® For many jeepney drivers, today's big-time oil price hike translates to daily fuel expenses soaring to approximately P1,800 ‚Äî an amount that exceeds both the NCR minimum wage of P645 and the family living wage of P1,200.

This is further compounded by regressive taxes on fuel such as VAT and excise tax that disproportionately affect the poor while allowing billionaires to benefit from tax breaks. PISTON estimates that jeepney drivers have lost around a total of P6,400 of income due to these oil taxes since the beginning of the year. 

READ MORE ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/sODDtkU9rl
translated:
üö® For many jeepney drivers, today's big-time oil price hikes translates to daily fuel expenses soaring to approximately P1,800-an amount that exceeds both the NCR minimum wage of P645 and the family living wage of P1,200.

This is further compounded by regressive taxes on fuel such as VAT and excise tax that disproportionately affect the poor while allowing billionaires to benefit from tax breaks.Piston estimates that jeepney drivers have lost around a total of P6,400 of income due to these oil taxes since the beginning of the year.

READ MORE ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/soddtku9rl

text: if a new jeepney costs 1M & driver would be borrowing money to pay for it. if loan is for 5 years then 1000000/5/12 = 16,666 /mo. PHP757 /day. at PHP20 per passenger that's 40 passengers only for loan. No gasoline, living wage, maintenance or other fees. PHP50 is not unreasonable

text: Jeepney phaseout? No. Ang dapat i-phaseout ay yung mga lintik na PUV driver na barubal sa kalsada. Mga jeepney drives, bus drivers, UV Express drivers at taxi drivers na siraulo ang dapat tanggalin. Ewan ko ba kung bakit ang dali-dali kumuha ng driver‚Äôs license sa Pinas.
translated: Jeepney phaseout?No.The phaseout is the PUV drivers who are on the road.Jeepney drives, bus drivers, UV express drivers and taxi drivers that are to be removed.Do I know why it is easy to get a driver's license in Pinas.

text:
Ignorant people making this about the jeepney phaseout. ü•¥ 

Do you even ride jeepneys at all? It's not even the vehicle's fault but the driver's. So kahit maging e-jeep yan, kung kamote ang driver this WILL happen. 

Condolences to the bereaved families.
translated:
Ignorant people making this about the jeepney phaseout.ü•¥

Do you even ride jeepneys at all?It's not even the vehicle's fault but the driver's.So even if it's e-jeep, if the driver is a sweet potato it will happen.

Condolences to the bereaved families.

text:
Humaharipas yung jeepney biglang nawalan ng control yung driver. Malamang may bumitaw sa suspension/steering. Kasi gawa-gawa lang lahat. 

Tapos ayaw pa din phaseout ang mga lumang jeepney. Yung driver barumbado na tapos yung sasakyan walang kasiguruhan na ligtas ang pasahero. 

Walang kadala-dala ang gobyerno kasi ayaw mawalan ng boto.
translated:
The jeepney passed by the driver suddenly lost control.It is likely that something has appeared in the suspension/steering.Because it's all fiction.

Then the old jeepneys still don't phaseout.The driver of the bar is finished with the vehicle that the passenger is safe.

The government has nothing to do because he does not want to lose its vote.

text:
LOOK: Jeepney drivers in Caloocan City are lamenting reduced income following another significant oil price hike implemented on Tuesday, 21 September.

Bladdy, a driver on the MCU-Fishermall route, shared that he plans to cut back on food expenses to ensure he can still bring home money for his family.

Diesel prices rose by P2.70 per liter, gasoline by P1.65 per liter, and kerosene by P2.50 per liter. This marks the third consecutive week of price increases for diesel and gasoline. | Aljon Eguia

#OilPriceHike #DailyTribune
translated:
LOOK: Jeepney Drivers in Caloocan City are lamenting reduced income following another significant oil price hike implemented on Tuesday, 21 September.

Bladdy, a driver on the MCU-fishermall route, shared that he plans to cut back on food expenses to ensure he can still bring home money for his family.

Diesel prices rose by P2.70 per liter, gasoline by P1.65 per liter, and kerosene by P2.50 per liter.This marks the third consecutive week of price increases for diesel and gasoline.|Aljon Eguia

#Oilpresehike #dailytribune
